description: Demolition of the existing Unit 6a office block; proposed single-storey extension to Unit 6a; proposed two-storey extension to Unit 6b; conversion into a single building for flexible light industrial (Use Class Egiii), general industrial B2, and storage and distribution B8 uses with ancillary offices; and refurbishment of the remainder of the building, associated parking and landscape planting
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (11507_PL_001, 11507_PL_002, 11507_PL_003, 11507_PL_004, 11507_PL_006, 11507_PL_008, 11507_PL_009, 11507_PL_010, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Archaeological Desk Based Assessment, Biodiversity Metric Assessment, Bird Hazard Management Plan, BREEAM UK NC 2018 Pre-Assessment Report, B21042_TR01(1) Rev C (Swept Path Analysis Plan), Cover Letter, Construction Ecological Management Plan, Design and Access Statement, Energy Strategy Report, External Lighting Proposals, Landscape and Ecological Management Plan, Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment, Preliminary Ecological Appraisal, Planning Noise Assessment, Planning Statement and Transport Statement. Received 24 February 2023; Geo-Environmental & Geotechnical Assessment (Ground Investigation) Report. Received 10 March 2023; Solar Photovoltaic Glint and Glare Study. Received 5 June 2023; 11507_PL_005_B, 11507_PL_007_A, 11507_PL_020_B, 11507_PL_021_B, Construction Logistics Plan, Drainage Assessment Form, Delivery and Servicing Plan and Travel Plan. Received 13 June 2023; Dusk Emergence & Dawn Re-entry Bat Surveys. Received 23 June 2023; Flood Risk Assessment & Drainage Strategy Report. Received 7 July 2023; Fire Engineering Statement. Received 7 August 2023; Air Quality Impact Assessment. Received 11 August 2023; 13374-SK100_P1, 13374-SK103_P1, 13374-102_T2, 13374_108_P1, Drainage Design Report and SUDS Maintenance Plan. Received 27 September 2023; Transport Response to Objection 1 and Transport Response to Objection 2. Received 20 October 2023; Greenfield Runoff Rates: Rainfall calculations. Received 27 October 2023) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - During the course of the development:

a.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess any such additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.

b.	Soils or other landscaping materials imported to the site (if applicable) should be demonstrated to be safe for use in accordance with a scheme of verification and testing to be agreed with the local authority.

Before the development is first brought into use:

c.	The agreed scheme for decontamination (if applicable) referred to in clause a) and b) above, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 5 - The development hereby approved, shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the hard and soft landscaping details shown on the submitted plans and documents and shall be maintained as such at all times thereafter.
Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 6 - a.	Within ten months of work starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.

b.	Within ten months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use, a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

c.	Within three months of work starting on site evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM Design Stage certification targeting the above score.

d.	Within six months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use, evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM As-Built certification targeting the above score.

Condition : 7 - a) The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy.
(b) Prior to first occupation of any dwelling within the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method) shall be submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 108.9% reduction in emissions.
(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.

Condition : 9 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a final Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. 

The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of  a minimum output of 7.2kW, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 
The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards. The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, with photographic evidence submitted to the Local Planning Authority upon completion, and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 12 - Secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 26 bicycles) for employees of, and visitors to, the development shall be installed in the cycle shelter. The approved facilities shall conform to the current Westtrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance (or such other guidance as shall supersede it) in design and layout and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 13 - Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), the applicant must submit a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations and updated Drainage Assessment Form to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval, aligned with the Flood Risk Assessment & Drainage Strategy Report (07/07/2023), Proposed Drainage Plan numbered 13374-102_T2 (27/09/2023), and associated drawings.
A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development.

Condition : 14 - No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Condition : 15 - The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the recommendations approved in the Landscape and Ecological Management Plan received on 24 February 2023.
Condition : 16 - The hereby approved development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved Solar Photovoltaic Glint and Glare Study received on 5 June 2023.

Condition : 17 - All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Condition : 19 - The cumulative noise from the on-site operations associated with the development hereby approved, shall not  exceed the following levels  when measured at accessible free-field that are representative of the facades of nearby sensitive receptors:
"	Daytime LAeq,16hours 45 dB(A);
"	Night-time LAeq,8hours 40 dB(A) 
"	Night-time LAFmax 55 dB(A) no more than 10 times per night from individual events associated with on-site operational activity at the site.

Condition : 20 - ll refuse and recycling bins and delivery carts in association with the approved development are to be stored within the building at all times and only brought out when deliveries are being made or refuse collected.

Condition : 21 - The hereby approved development shall be implemented in accordance with the recommendations approved in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment during construction to protect the health of existing trees and shall be maintained as such for the duration of the construction works.

Condition : 22 - Artificial lighting as part of the completed development shall be designed to meet the Obtrusive Light Limitations for Exterior Lighting Installations for Suburban Zone - E3 set out in Table 2 of the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Obtrusive Light, 01/21 (https://theilp.org.uk/publication/guidance-note-1-for-the-reduction-of-obtrusive-light-2021/) or such other guidance as may supersede it. The installation shall be examined by a lighting engineer affiliated to a nationally recognised body that specialises in the field of external lighting and certified to confirm that it complies with this standard before it is first brought into use and a copy of the certificate supplied to the local planning authority to confirm compliance before the lights are first brought into operation.
